data.title: Judicial & Administration – Juvenile Court of Metropolitan Nashville & Davidson County
data.text:
Anthony “Tony” Smith – Public Information Coordinator/Community Outreach Supervisor

615-862-8055 Office

615-708-2765 Cell

anthonyfsmith@jisnashville.gov

Anthony “Tony” Smith received his Bachelor of Science degree in Social Sciences from Tennessee State University in Nashville, TN. While attending Tennessee State University, he was a member of the critically acclaimed and now, Grammy Award winning, Aristocrat of Bands. Being a native Nashvillian, Tony is also a graduate of Whites Creek Comprehensive High School, where he now serves as the representative for the Class of 1983 for the Whites Creek High School Alumni Network. Upon graduation from Tennessee State University, he earned the Master of Arts degree in Organizational Leadership from Trevecca Nazarene University in Nashville, TN. Tony has also received certification as a Master Public Information Officer from the University of Tennessee Law Enforcement Innovation Center.

Prior to joining the Juvenile Court family, Tony served as a Team of Experts (TEX) Coach at T-Mobile USA, Inc., spearheading community development, public relations, and communications. His achievements earned him recognition, such as being a T-Mobile ‘Red Carpet’ Symposium Honoree and the T-Mobile PEAK Achievement Award.

Tony is married and is the father of 6 children. He enjoys playing golf and cheering for his beloved Pittsburgh Steelers.

As the Public Information Coordinator for Juvenile Court, Tony facilitates the communication of the court’s work toward fulfilling their mission to the public at large. Tony also facilitates responses to inquiries from the public and stands waiting to meet you and share information with you.
